text: Abdullah Abu Ma'aruf (, ; born 30 December 1956) is an Israeli Druze doctor and politician. He served as a member of the Knesset for the Joint List between 2015 and 2017. ==Biography== Born in Yarka, Abu Ma'aruf studied medicine in the Soviet Union after receiving a scholarship from the Israeli Communist Party, and gained Russian citizenship. He specialised in urology and family medicine, and currently works at Carmel Medical Centre. He was amongst the first conscientious objectors in the Druze community,Meet Israel's new lawmakers Ynetnews, 20 March 2015 and is an active member of Physicians for Human Rights. He has also been written for the Communist Party's Arab language newspaper Al-Ittihad. A member of Hadash, prior to the 2015 elections he was placed thirteenth on the Joint List list, an alliance of Hadash, Balad, the Islamic Movement, the United Arab List and Ta'al.Joint List list Central Elections Committee He was elected to the Knesset as the alliance won 13 seats.Final Unofficial* results of the Elections for the Twentieth Knesset Central Elections Committee After he was elected, he was required to give up his Russian citizenship.Five new MKs must give up foreign citizenship Haaretz, 26 March 2015 In 2017 he resigned from the Knesset as part of a rotation agreement and was replaced by Said al-Harumi from the United Arab List.Report: Internal Rotation Fight Threatens Future of Joint Arab List Jewish Press, 31 July 2017 ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1956 births Category:Druze people of Israeli nationality Category:Druze people of Russian nationality Category:People from Northern District (Israel) Category:Israeli physicians Category:Arab politicians in Israel Category:Hadash politicians Category:Joint List politicians Category:Members of the 20th Knesset (2015–2019)
